intro: Phyllocosmus congolensis, commonly known as the Congo thistle, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in a compact cluster. It has a robust root system and can thrive in a variety of soil types, though it prefers well-drained conditions. Phyllocosmus congolensis is often found in forest understories and is adapted to the humid climate of its native habitat.
